title: 2016 02 Level 1 or 2?
When and How Do They Land?
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/EjG0T4FjJA-8869d4fe2957ec8d641dcf158de22b143076c84810443d3eda44a08ddf2b1682.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"From the top of a tower, one ball is dropped and another thrown horizontally with a velocity "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". How will they reach the ground?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assumptions and Details","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Neglect the rotation of the Earth."}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Both situations have an initial speed, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", of 0. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
But let's say that the height is 10 meters     "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You can use the "suvat" equations to solve for both.    "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For the vertical ball: "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} 
v^2 &=& u^2 + 2as \\
v &=& = \sqrt{0^2 + 2as} \\
&=& \sqrt{2 \cdot 9.81 \cdot 10} \\
&\approx& 14.00 \text{ m/s} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And to find the time taken:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} 
v &=& u + at \\
&=& 0 + at \\
t &=& \frac va \\
&=& 14/9.81 \\
&\approx& 1.43 \text{ s} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For the horizontal ball, "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
there are 2 components therefore it is a different speed "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v^2_{x}=u^2_{x} + 2as_{x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" horizontal component. "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v^2_{y}=u^2_{y} + 2as_{y}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" vertical component."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            But I wrote it as "will reach the ground". It has the same meaning as "about to strike", right?

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I think the question is worded poorly. As I recall in school the always used the term "just before striking the ground" This prevents the confusion that the object stops when it hits the ground. Both objects stop when they " reach the ground!"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Nothing was said in the problem as stated about ignoring the Earth's curvature.  The ball with horizontal component will reach the surface later and at a greater speed.  In order to meet the criteria of making an accurate scientific statement, be very careful to be precise in your wording.  That said, there was also nothing said about the initial speed and that could be stated as being great enough to escape Earth's gravitational field, in which case that ball would not only not hit the ground, it would be on its merry way into the solar system.  Where is unimportant.  I want a credit for the "Oops" I was given, when in fact I was correct based upon the available information.  Admittedly, I limited the horizontal component so that ball would also strike the surface.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Considering that there's no air resistance and ignoring the curvature of the Earth, yes, they will reach the ground at the same time."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If there's air resistance they experience different magnitude of air resistance depending on the medium they travel.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            so you want to say if i drop bullet from 10m and in same time i shoot bullet horizontal two of thouse bullets will hit ground at same time"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Calvin edited the comment.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: Roots Both Ways
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\large y =\\sqrt { x+20160 } -\\sqrt { x-20160 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many solutions exist for the above, such that both "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are "},{"type":"text","text":"integers","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: General Diophantine Equations - Problem Solving","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m,x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are integers such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{x + 20160} - \sqrt{x - 20160} = m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then certainly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x,m \in \mathrm{N}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", while "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x \ge 20160"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m \le \sqrt{2 \times 20160} = 2\sqrt{10080}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus, on squaring,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{array}{rcl}
2x - 2\sqrt{x^2 - 20160^2} & = & m^2 \\
2x - m^2 & = & 2\sqrt{x^2 - 20160^2} \\
(2x - m^2)^2 & = & 4\big[x^2 - 20160^2\big] \\
4m^2x & = & m^4 + 4\times20160^2
\end{array} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m^4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be even, and so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must be even. Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m = 2n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for some "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n \in \mathrm{N}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n^2x \; = \; n^4 + 10080^2 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Thus "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" must divide "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10080"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and hence we must have
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" x \; = \; n^2 + \big(\tfrac{10080}{n}\big)^2 \qquad \qquad m \; = \; 2n "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
for any positive integer divisor "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10080"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for which "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n \le \sqrt{10080}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10080 = 2^5 \times 3^2 \times 5 \times 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6\times3\times2\times2 = 72"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" positive integer divisors of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10080"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10080"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is not a perfect square, exactly half of these are less than or equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{10080}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thus there are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\tfrac{72}{2} = \boxed{36}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" solutions in integers to this equation."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
